frame.name: Vote
frame.definition: <def-root> An <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex > makes a voting decision on an <fex name="Issue">Issue</fex >. <fex name="Issue">Issues</fex > can be bills, resolutions, nominations, and treaties, and others on procedural matters. A ​<fex name="Frequency">Frequency</fex > of the voting decision may be stated. <ex><fex name="Agent">Mitch McConnell</fex> <t>voted</t> <fex name="Frequency">three times</fex> <fex name="Position">for</fex> <fex name="Issue">corporate tax breaks that send Kentucky jobs overseas</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Tom Cotton</fex> <t>voted</t> <fex name="Position">against</fex> <fex name="Issue">preparing America for pandemics like Ebola</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root> The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the voting decision on an <fex name="Issue">Issue</fex>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Sen. Mark Begich</fex> cast the <t>deciding</t> <t>vote</t> in favor of President Obama's authority to issue executive amnesty to illegal aliens.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Issue
FE.definition: <def-root> The matter which the <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex> has a positive or negative opinion about and either votes for or votes against. <ex>Bernie Sanders <t>voted</t> against <fex name="Issue">the Brady Bill -- background checks and waiting periods</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Side
FE.definition: <def-root> The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the voting decision on an <fex name="Issue">Issue</fex> together with the <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex>. <ex>Bernie Sanders <t>voted</t> <fex name="Side">with Republicans</fex> to protect the Minutemen , a hate group that used military tactics against our community .</def-root>

FE.name: Position
FE.definition: <def-root> This FE identifies the position that the <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex> takes on an <fex name="Issue">Issue</fex>. The <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex> either votes for or against. <ex>He <t>voted</t> <fex name="Position">for</fex> disaster relief and full funding of FEMA.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root> The number of times that the <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex> made the same voting decision on an <fex name="Issue">Issue</fex>. <ex>Mitch McConnell <t>voted</t> <fex name="Frequency">two times</fex> against "the Violence Against Women Act". </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root> This FE identifies the time when the <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex> performs the voting decision. <ex><fex name="Time">This week</fex> the House of Representatives <t>voted</t> to remove the word ‘lunatic' from federal law.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the voting decision took place. <ex> <fex name="Place">In the Senate</fex> , Mike DeWine <t>voted</t> with Hillary Clinton to let illegal immigrants receive Social Security . </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Support_rate
FE.definition: <def-root> The percentage of Agent's total votes, in which the Agent took the same position with a Side for a specific period of time. <ex>Congressman Joe Heck has <t>voted</t> <fex name="Support_rate">62 percent of the time</fex> with Nancy Pelosi and the Democrats on a variety of important issues . </ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: vote.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to express or signify (one's preference, opinion, or will) (for or against some matter, etc).

lexUnit.name: (a/the) deciding vote.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a vote that someone may exercise to resolve a deadlock.
